head.title: TYCO INTERNATIONAL SELLS BRANDS TO BEIERSDORF

hedline.hl1: TYCO INTERNATIONAL SELLS BRANDS TO BEIERSDORF

block.p: Tyco International Ltd. said yesterday that it had agreed to sell its Curad and Futuro brands of bandages to Beiersdorf A.G. of Germany for $165 million. Tyco, based in Exeter, N.H., said it would make the products for Beiersdorf under a long-term deal. Tyco said the businesses had annual sales of more than $100 million. The German company is established in the consumer health care sector with its Nivea and Eucerin skin lotions in the United States. Tyco's stock was unchanged, at $35.50, on the New York Stock Exchange.
